      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Restriction<T> between(PropertyReference<Bean,V> propRef, V startValue, V endValue)
      Compares a property against two values using a between clause. This will throw an exception if either startValue or endValue, or both are null.
      Restriction<T> between(String propertyName, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a property against two values using a between clause. This will throw an exception if either startValue or endValue, or both are null. Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      Restriction<T> compare(PropertyReference<Bean,V> propRef, Relop op, V value)
      Compares a property against a value given an operation type.
      Restriction<T> compare(String propertyName, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a property against a value given an operation type. Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      Restriction<T> compare(PropertyReference<Bean,V> propRef, Range<V> value)
      Compares a property against a range.
      Restriction<T> compare(String propertyName, Range<Object> value)
      Compares a property against a range.
      Restriction<T> compareIgnoreCase(PropertyReference<Bean,String> propRef, Relop op, String value)
      Compares a property against a value given an operation type. The comparison is done using the configured lignuistic search function, which varies by database type, but is typically "lower", that is, case insenstively.
      Restriction<T> compareIgnoreCase(String propertyName, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a property against a value given an operation type. The comparison is done using the configured lignuistic search function, which varies by database type, but is typically "lower", that is, case insenstively. Value must be of type String. If a case-insensitive comparison that helps drive the query plan is done on a large table, then the property should have the supportsLinguisticSearch attribute and the denorm column indexed.
      Restriction<T> compareIn(PropertyReference<Bean,V> propRef, Object[] values)
      Compares a property against a range of values using an in clause
      Restriction<T> compareIn(String propertName, Object[] values)
      Compares a property against a range of values using an in clause
      Restriction<T> compareNotIn(PropertyReference<Bean,V> propRef, Object[] values)
      Compares a property against a range of values using a not in clause
      Restriction<T> compareNotIn(String propertyName, Object[] values)
      Compares a property against a range of values using a not in clause
      Restriction<T> contains(String propertyName, DBFunction value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar property against a DBFunction.Constant string value using a contains clause (i.e. property='%string%')
      Restriction<T> contains(String propertyName, String value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar property against a string value using a contains clause (i.e. property='%string%')
      Restriction<T> contains(PropertyReference<Bean,String> propRef, String value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar property against a string value using a contains clause (i.e. property='%string%')
      ColumnRef getColumnRef(String propertyName)
      Returns a reference to the column that backs the given property
      Table<Bean> inlineView(IEntityPropertyInfo columnInThisTable, Query<T> inlineViewQuery, IEntityPropertyInfo columnInOtherTable)
      Used to join this table to another table specifying both columns. This method will join two tables with both keys specified in the method signature Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns
      Table<QT> inlineView(String joinPropertyOnThisEntity, Query<Bean> inlineViewQuery, String joinPropertyOnViewEntity)
      Used to join another query as an inline view. This will produce a query with the inlineViewQuery as a inline view and will automatically select all referenced properties from that query in the select statement. For example: var viewQuery = Query.make(TestA) var outerQuery = Query.make(TestE) var inlineView = outerQuery.inlineView("ID", viewQuery, "E") outerQuery.compare("E", GreaterThan, inlineView.getColumnRef(DBFunction.Max("A"))) print(outerQuery.select().AtMostOneRow.ID) This would print the id of a TestE where TestE.E > MAX(all TestA's related to this TestE) and would generate the SQL select * from TestE INNER JOIN (select E, Max(A) MAX_A from TestA) testA_view GROUP BY E ON TestE.ID = testA_view.E AND TestE.E > testA_view.MAX_A
      Table<Bean> join(ILinkPropertyInfo column)
      Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key. If the FK property is on this table, this method will join from this table to another. If the two tables have already been joined, when the SQL is generated, the two tables will be joined only once and the restrictions will be combined. If the FK property is on another table, this method will join from the remote table to this table. If the two tables have already been joined, when the SQL is generated, there will be as many joins as the number of times that this method has been invoked. The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns
      Table<QT> join(String propertyOnThisEntity)
      Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key in this table The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table
      Table<QT> join(PropertyReference<Bean,Bean> propRef)
      Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key in this table, or from an FK on another table to this one. The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table.
      Table<QT> join(IType type, String propertyOnOtherEntity)
      Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key in another table. The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table
      Table<Bean> outerJoin(ILinkPropertyInfo column)
      Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key using an outer join This method will join from this table to another if the FK property is on this table. This method will join from the remote table to this table if the FK property is on another table The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns
      Table<QT> outerJoin(String propertyOnThisEntity)
      Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key in this table using an outer join The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table
      Table<QT> outerJoin(IType type, String propertyOnOtherEntity)
      Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key in another table using an outer join The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table
      Table<QT> outerJoin(PropertyReference<Bean,Bean> propRef)
      Used to join this table via an outer join to another table via a foreign key in this table, or from an FK on another table to this one.
      Restriction<T> startsWith(String propertyName, DBFunction value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar property against a string value using a starts-with clause (i.e. property='string%'
      Restriction<T> startsWith(String propertyName, String value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar property against a string value using a starts-with clause (i.e. property='string%'
      Restriction<T> startsWith(PropertyReference<Bean,String> propRef, String value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar property against a string value using a starts-with clause (i.e. property='string%'
      Table<T> subselect(PropertyReference<Bean,Object> thisPropRef, InOperation op, PropertyReference<Bean,Object> joinPropRef)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause. Two propertiess are required, a property in the current table and a property in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      Table<T> subselect(PropertyReference<Bean,Object> thisPropRef, InOperation op, DBFunction joinFunction)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause. Two properties are required, a property in the current table and a property in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      Table<T> subselect(DBFunction thisTableFunction, InOperation op, PropertyReference<Bean,Object> joinPropRef)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause. Two properties are required, a property in the current table and a property in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      Table<T> subselect(String propertyInThisEntity, InOperation op, IEntityType typeToJoinTo, String propertyInJoinEntity)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause. Two propertiess are required, a property in the current table and a property in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      Table<T> subselect(String propertyInThisEntity, InOperation op, DBFunction joinFunction)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause. Two properties are required, a property in the current table and a property in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      Table<T> subselect(DBFunction thisTableFunction, InOperation op, IEntityType typeToJoinTo, String propertyInJoinEntity)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause. Two properties are required, a property in the current table and a property in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn

      Joins a property from table with a property from another query. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      Table<T> subselect(String propertyInThisEntity, InOperation op, IQuery<Bean> queryToJoinTo, String propertyInQuery)

      Joins a property wrapped by a function from table with a property from another query. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      Table<T> subselect(PropertyReference<Bean,Object> thisPropRef, InOperation op, IQuery<Bean> queryToJoinTo, DBFunction propertyInQuery)
      Joins a property wrapped by a function from table with a property from another query. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn

      IQueryBuilder<Bean> withDistinct(boolean distinct)
      Adds the distinct keyword to the query if distinct is true.
      Restriction<T> withinDistance(String propertyName, SpatialPoint center, Double distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Restriction<T> withinDistance(String propertyName, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, SpatialPoint center, Double distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Restriction<T> withinPolygon(String propertyName, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within.
      Restriction<T> withinPolygon(String propertyName, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within.

                 IQuery<Bean> queryToJoinTo,
                 PropertyReference<Bean,Object> qPropRef)
        Joins a property from table with a property wrapped by a function from another query. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn. This will generate a NOT EXISTS clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
        Parameters:
        propertyInThisEntity - the property in the current table to compare against
        op - the in clause operation
        queryToJoinTo - the joining query
        qPropRef - the joining property in the query
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • getColumnRef

        ColumnRef getColumnRef(String propertyName)
        Returns a reference to the column that backs the given property
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property to get a reference from. The property must be on this table
        Returns:
        a reference to the column that backs the given property

      • withinDistance

        Restriction<T> withinDistance(String propertyName,
                            SpatialPoint center,
                            Double distance,
                            UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
        Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property in the current table
        center - the point to search from
        distance - the range to search for
        unitOfDistance - the unit of distance
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • withinDistance

        Restriction<T> withinDistance(String propertyName,
                            String beanPathToSpatialColumn,
                            SpatialPoint center,
                            Double distance,
                            UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
        Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property in the current table
        beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity.
        center - the point to search from
        distance - the range to search for
        unitOfDistance - the unit of distance
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • withinPolygon

        Restriction<T> withinPolygon(String propertyName,
                           boolean findIn,
                           SpatialPolygon polygon)
        Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within.
        Parameters:
        propertyName -
        findIn - true for finding points in the polygon; false for finding points outside the polygons.
        polygon - the polygon to search
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • withinPolygon

      • inlineView

        Table<Bean> inlineView(IEntityPropertyInfo columnInThisTable,
                     Query<T> inlineViewQuery,
                     IEntityPropertyInfo columnInOtherTable)
        Used to join this table to another table specifying both columns. This method will join two tables with both keys specified in the method signature Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns
        Parameters:
        columnInThisTable -
        inlineViewQuery -
        columnInOtherTable -
        Returns:
        the table being joined to, i.e., the table referred to by column.

      • join

        Table<Bean> join(ILinkPropertyInfo column)
        Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key. If the FK property is on this table, this method will join from this table to another. If the two tables have already been joined, when the SQL is generated, the two tables will be joined only once and the restrictions will be combined. If the FK property is on another table, this method will join from the remote table to this table. If the two tables have already been joined, when the SQL is generated, there will be as many joins as the number of times that this method has been invoked. The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns
        Parameters:
        column - the FK to join through
        Returns:
        the table being joined to, i.e., the table referred to by column.

      • outerJoin

        Table<Bean> outerJoin(ILinkPropertyInfo column)
        Used to join this table to another table via a foreign key using an outer join This method will join from this table to another if the FK property is on this table. This method will join from the remote table to this table if the FK property is on another table The FK will be joined with the ID of the corresponding table Adding additional columns will cause the join to be specified as a select. The additional columns can contain SQL functions allowing you to do an implicit group by on the remaining columns
        Parameters:
        column - the FK to join through
        Returns:
        the table being joined to, i.e., the table referred to by column.

      • inlineView

        Table<QT> inlineView(String joinPropertyOnThisEntity,
                   Query<Bean> inlineViewQuery,
                   String joinPropertyOnViewEntity)
        Used to join another query as an inline view. This will produce a query with the inlineViewQuery as a inline view and will automatically select all referenced properties from that query in the select statement. For example: var viewQuery = Query.make(TestA) var outerQuery = Query.make(TestE) var inlineView = outerQuery.inlineView("ID", viewQuery, "E") outerQuery.compare("E", GreaterThan, inlineView.getColumnRef(DBFunction.Max("A"))) print(outerQuery.select().AtMostOneRow.ID) This would print the id of a TestE where TestE.E > MAX(all TestA's related to this TestE) and would generate the SQL select * from TestE INNER JOIN (select E, Max(A) MAX_A from TestA) testA_view GROUP BY E ON TestE.ID = testA_view.E AND TestE.E > testA_view.MAX_A
        Parameters:
        joinPropertyOnThisEntity -
        inlineViewQuery -
        joinPropertyOnViewEntity -
        Returns:
